result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny K. Pinder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.dnaas

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

Defendant Johnny K. Pinder in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State submits certified copies of defendants judgments of convictions. Statement by victim A.G. Court renders sentence. No sentence credit.
Guilty-both counts
Jury question (2)
Stipulation and Order for Return Exhibits
11/30/2015 & 12/1/2015 Trial       Exhibit 1 - DVD (located in CD/DVD exhibit binder)   Exhibits 4 thru 10 located on SH 4-3 in Exhibit Room

Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Johnny Pinder appears in person and by Atty. Matthew Weil. Defendant Darnelle Polk appears in person and by Atty. Matt Last. Defendant Johnny Pinder examined by Court and notified he can wear street clothes in lieu of jail uniform. Mr. Pinder does states he wishes to proceed in jail uniform.

  9:07 am  36 jurors reported and given oath.
  9:08 am  22 jurors called to jury box.
  9:12 am  Voir dire by court.
  9:44 am  Voir dire by Atty. Gerol.
  9:58 am  Voir dire by Atty. Last.
10:05 am  Voir dire by Atty. Weil.
10:10 am  Court/jurors recess.
10:20 am  Court in session. Atty. Weil continues voir dire.
10:25 am  Striking of jury by counsel.
10:30 am  12 jurors called to hear case.
10:32 am  Court thanks extra jurors and excuses them from the courtroom.
10:35 am  Jury given oath, court statement to jurors.
10:38 am  Jury recess.
10:40 am  Witness to be sequestered. Court recess.
11:00 am  Opening statement by Atty. Gerol. 
11:14 am  Opening statement by Atty. Last.
11:18 am  Opening statement by Atty. Weil.
11:22 am  W.M. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Last, Atty. Weil,redirect by Atty. Gerol, exam by Court.
11:35 am  A.G. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, no crossexam by Atty. Last, crossexam by Atty. Weil. 
11:47 am  J.S. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol. 
11:54 am  Court/jury lunch recess until 1:00 pm 
  1:10 pm  Court/jury in session. Atty. Gerol plays video on Exhibit #1.
  1:15 pm  Det. C. Polishinski sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Last, crossexam by Atty. Weil, redirect.
  1:45 pm  Officer R. Glejf sworn and tetified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Last, crossexam by Atty. Weil, redirect, recross by Atty. Last.
  2:05 pm  Officer S. Mortl sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Last, crossexam by Atty. Weil.
  2:15 pm  Sgt. M. Kasten sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol.
  2:20 pm  Officer B. Vashholtz sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Weil. 
  2:28 pm  Court/jury recess. 
  2:55 pm  Court is informed State will rest. Court examines defendant as to their right to testify. 
  2:58 pm  Atty. Last motion for directed verdict. Atty. Weil motion for directed verdict. Court amends the information to reflect burglary of an  "office" in lieu of building or dwelling. 
                  Court denies motion. 
  3:08 pm  State rests/Defense rests. Jury excused.
  3:10 pm  Court held jury instruction/verdict conference.
  3:42 pm  Closing statement by Atty. Gerol. 
  3:52 pm  Closing statement by Atty. Last.
  4:02 pm  Closing statement by Atty. Weil.
  4:08 pm  Closing statement by Atty. Gerol.
  4:14 pm   Court instructs jury.
  4:40 pm   Bailiff sworn.
  4:42 pm   Jury leaves for deliberation.
  4:55 pm   Court received a question from jury.
  5:06 pm   Court/counsel/defendants in court. Court will provide the following exhibits to the jury: 1A, 1B, 2, 3 & 10
  6:15 pm   Court/counsel/defendants in court. Court notifies counsel as to jury question. 
  6:24 pm   Jury present in Court. Court statement to jury to continue deliberation. 
  6:25 pm   Jury returns for deliberation.
  7:45 pm   Court/counsel/defendants in court. Discussion as to how to proceed.
  7:47 pm   Court is informed jury has reached a verdict.
  7:48 pm   Court/counsel/defendant/jury in court. Verdict read: As to Johnny Pinder Ct. 1- Guilty  Ct. 2- Guilty /  As to Darnelle Polk Ct. 3-Not Guilty  Ct. 4-Guilty
  7:49 pm   Jury polled.
  7:50 pm   Jury thanked and excused. 
                   Court  grants judgment on the verdict, revokes Johnny Pinder's bail and remands him custody. Atty. Weil is not requesting a presentence report. Court schedules sentencing on 12/1/2015 at 1:30 pm. 
                   Court orders Darnelle Polk sentenced to 30 days jail with credit for time served. Court orders Mr. Polk submit DNA sample and pay court costs with payment plan of $25 per mo comm 1/2/2016.

Defendant Johnny K. Pinder in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Last states he is prepared for trial on 9/29/2015 and objects to adjournment. Atty. Weil request to adjourn trial, defendant Mr. Pinder is now at Racine Correctional, he needs additional time to review discovery with defendant. Atty. Weil further states there is a possible consolidation of Mr. Pinder's case. Defendant Pinder states he does not object to adjournment of trial. Atty. Gerol requests cases be tried together. Court will keep both these cases on for trial on 9/29. Defendant Polk enters speedy trial demand. Mr. Pinder to remain in Ozaukee County so Atty. Weil may review case. Motion to suppress will be heard the morning of trial.

Defendant Johnny K. Pinder with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Defendant in custody and appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises of the penalties.  State requesting $15,000 cash bail w/conditions.  Counsel advises defendant is on an ES hold.  Court orders $15,000 cash bail w/conditions:  No contact with property at 1025 West Glen Oaks or with A.G. or J.S.  Counsel requesting prelim hrg; not waiving timelimits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
